text:
The new javac attribute "encoding" is passed
as -encoding to jikes. As jikes 1.14 does
not support this attribute, it will print
an error message and try to compile the
specified encoding.

Opposed to the actual behaviour, I would think,
that the jikes adapter should ignore this
attribute and/or print a warning message.

I have not yet tried this with ant 1.4.1, so
probably this has already been fixed. (The 
readme does not mention a fix.)
creator: mkerkhof@jamba-ag.de
umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
Isn't it really an issue of backwards compatibility on jikes' part?  They could 
have kept the encoding flag just like they have kept the debug flag (which has
no effect).

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
As jikes 1.13 supports the -encoding argument, users of this version
will expect Ant to pass it to jikes.  We cannot determine the version of jikes
easily, so I think we'll better stick to the current behavior.

Jikes 1.15 also doesn't support -encoding and I assume no future
jikes version will support it. So, as time goes passes, more and 
more users will move from jikes 1.13 to more up-to-date jikes 
versions not supporting -encoding.

All these users will be confronted with the problem I'm currently
struggling with - how can I use the encoding attribute with both
suns's javac and jikes. 

Probably we should look into the jikes 1.13 code and examine how
the encoding argument is handled. If it's just implemented as a 
no-op, I would still favor my original suggestion.
creator: mkerkhof@jamba-ag.de

text:
reopening it to easy discussion.

OK, I looked at the source - jikes still supports the -encoding attribute if it
is compiled with the proper libraries for it, see src/option.cpp, line 344:

#if defined(HAVE_LIBICU_UC) || defined(HAVE_ICONV_H)
            else if (strcmp(arguments.argv[i], "-encoding") == 0 &&
                     ((i + 1) < arguments.argc))

so we should definitively keep the -encoding attribute for jikes.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
